fields.description:
h3. Summary
* The version's page does not automatically load completely preventing users to search for versions which are at the bottom of the page
* This issue did not occur in JIRA 4

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 6.4.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a long list of versions ( 50+ versions )
# Open the version page in new tab and try to search the version right at the bottom using the browser search ( CTRL +F )

h3. Expected Results
* The browser should be able to detect the search

h3. Actual Results
* Version is not found unless user scrolls down which will load the remaining bottom part of the page
* User has to scroll down alot if they have 100 over versions. Not efficient 
 

h3.Workaround
* Scrolling down is a workaround but its not efficient. 

h3.Suggestion
* Build a built-in version finder on the Versions page
fields.summary: Versions page do not completely load preventing search from browser

fields.description:
I found JRA-44147 which encompasses the general issue that I've been encountering but wanted to add some other info that I have noticed about it as well and raise the priority. Overall the new feature to "Import Issues from CSV" under the Issues drop drop down doesn't reliably import all the data from a CSV as the "External System Import" does from the System admin section. In addition to certain field being imported inconsistently, such as time estimates in the linked issue, there are many custom fields that will not successfully import using the Issues import method.

Importing issues from CSV files is a critical and frequent step in our projects workflow and we would like to avoid having to give so many of our team members admin privileges just for the ability to successfully import issues. Any help in resolving this would be greatly appreciated.

bq. h2.Summary
bq. 
bq. {quote}
bq. I imported the attached CSV file (which contains a single issue with a 3hr 30min original estimate) using Issues -> Import Issues from CSV, and the new issue had an original estimate of 3 hours (see screenshot).
bq. 
bq. I imported the file using [Administration] -> System -> External System Import and the new issue had the correct original estimate of 3 hours 30 minutes.
bq. 
bq. I assumed the behaviour of both CSV importers would be identical.
bq. {quote}
bq. 
bq. User's description explains the bug the best. Basically there is a difference between the 2 importer and the value of the time fields are not 
bq. 
bq. h2.Steps to Replicate
bq. Create a new Agile project. Make sure that the *Time Estimate* field is added to the right screen and project.
bq. Import using Issues -> Import Issues from CSV. Resulting ticket is refered as Ticket A.
bq. Import the file using [Administration] -> System -> External System Import. Resulting ticket is refered as Ticket B.
bq. 
bq. h2.Expected Result
bq. The Remaining and Original Estimate field is showing different value. Ticket B is showing correct value while Ticket A is showing wrong value.
bq. 
bq. *Using Issue External Import*
bq. 
bq. !1.png|thumbnail!
bq. 
bq. *Using Administrator External System Import*
bq. 
bq. !2.png|thumbnail!
bq. 
bq. The correct time estimate value is 3 hours and 30 minutes.
bq. 
bq. h2.Current Result
bq. The Remaining and Original Estimate field is showing same value for both Ticket A and B.
bq. 
bq. h2.Note
bq. There are no error logs from Jira log during the import for both tickets. I've included test.csv for testing/replication purposes.
fields.summary: CSV Import from Issues is unreliable

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA only support issue-level [notificaiton scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-a-notification-scheme-185729542.html]. Any changes in a project will not be notified to anyone.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a project-level notification scheme or predefined set of notification scheme to [project roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Roles] and project lead.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create a notification by [adding a custom event|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/adding-a-custom-event-185729657.html] and the respective person to be notified.
fields.summary: Project-level Notification Scheme
Allow Wiki Markup in Custom Field Description

It is currently impossible to create a yes/no field without a "None" option added if the field is not "Required"

The problem with this approach is the field may not come into play until resolution time.  

So if I want to have a field like "Is X required?" and have a yes/no I can't do it, because:
* Making it required means the user needs to answer that on issue creation
* Making it optional throws in the "None" value

This is nuts.  Other fields can be null if optional, why not these?

h3. Problem Definition
Stability and up-time are important aspects on a product for Enterprise customers. Often we see one of the feature from an add-on consume large amount of resources causing JIRA to crash and become unavailable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Having an option to set per-plugin (per-addon) resource limit (and monitoring) to avoid the entire instance to become unavailable due to insufficient resources.

h3. Workaround 
On related cases, the process includes
# Reviewing support zip and thread dumps
# Analyze heap dump
# Identify the problem
# Disable/troubleshoot the add-on
fields.summary: Allow to Set Maximum Allocated Resource for Add-ons

h6. Problem Definition
As of now, should there an incremental synchronisation of an External User Directory fails in JIRA, the JIRA Administrator will only be able to identify it by navigating to _User Directories_ page itself.

h6. Suggested Solution
To implement email notifications feature in JIRA should incremental synchronisation fails so the JIRA Administrator would be able to detect it as soon as when the problem occurs to minimise the impact to JIRA users.
fields.summary: To Implement Email Notifications should Incremental Synchronisation Fails

fields.description:
We use an Active Directory server for authenticating our JIRA users, and a MySQL server for storing our JIRA data.

We were extremely alarmed to discover that the username and password used for accessing the AD server are stored in cleartext in the MySQL database.

Anyone who is able to compromise the JIRA database would then be able obtain broader credentials on the network.

Since our JIRA database is hosted on a different machine than the JIRA application, it would be significantly more secure for the password to be enciphered with a key stored on the application's host machine.

We have mitigated this threat by using an account that has very limited permissions, but this still poses an unacceptable risk to our information security.

We strongly urge Atlassian to implement some sensible encryption of the LDAP/AD credentials such as suggested above.
fields.summary: Active Directory/LDAP credentials stored in database in cleartext

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45605].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 30 October 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,

The apparent random behaviour was due to the fact that successfully pasting an image depended on the image itself. If the image contained "http" within its base64 binary representation, JIRA would consider it a link and ignore it.
Of course the chances of "http" appearing somewhere in the pasted image would go up when the image size goes up, and so this explains why this rarely occurred with smaller images.

Thank you for reporting this. Please let us know if you encounter more issues.
Cheers,
Mina
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45601].
  {panel}

It seems that the sensitive information leakage is something almost impossible to avoid when you have a pair of JIRA instances, internal and external, which are connected one to another.

Having them connected is clearly a business requirement for being able to cross link issues and to copy them from internal to external. 

Even so it seems that internal activity information goes to the public instance freely when you connected them. 

So far Atlassian support recommended to disable the activity feed plugin, but this change is not persisitent between service restarts not between service upgrades.

We do not a configurable option that is persistent like we already have the parameters for disabling email in JAVA_OPTS.

h3. Workaround:
Since the information shown is ruled by the permissions form each project, a workaround is to change the Browse permissions so the projects cannot be accessed by unauthenticated users. To do this, just make sure the Browse projects permission does not include "Anyone", "Anyone on the web" or "Public".
* Be aware that this will only prevent the information related to Jira issues to appear. Activity from other applications will require the other applications to similarly apply the permissions to prevent anonymous access.
fields.summary: Prevent Activity feed information leakage by allowing permanently disabling of it

h3. Summary
In 'Create Issue' dialog, if there is no matched Component with user's input, 'Component/s' filed should show an appropriate error message.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA
# Make a project
# Make sure the current user has a project administrator permission (if the user doesn't, grant the permission to the user)
# Add a component to the project (any component name could be)
# Add a version to the project (any version name could be)
# Open 'Create Issue' dialog
# Input all mandatory fields
# Input a component name which doesn't exist in the project in 'Component/s' field and put ESC key
# Input a version name which doesn't exist in the project in 'Affects Version/s' field and put ESC key
# Input a version name which doesn't exist in the project in 'Fix Version/s' field and put ESC key
# Click 'Create' button

h3. Expected Results
'Component/s' field should show an error *"Component with id 'xxxxx' does not exist."* as 'Affects Version/s' and 'Fix Version/s' field show such error messages.

h3. Actual Results
'Component/s' field doesn't show any error. (Please see a following image.)
!with_project_admin_permission.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
If the current user doesn't have a project administrator permission, the appropriate error message is shown. (Please see a following image.)
!without_project_admin_permission.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Component/s' filed should show an appropriate error message when creating an issue

h3. Summary

It is possible to install any 32 bit version of JIRA prior to JIRA 7 on Windows 7 64 bit, but installing 32 bit JIRA 7 on Windows 64 bit ends up with issues.

The root cause is, installer tries to run JIRA with incorrect version of tomcat binary

h3. Environment

Windows 7 64 bit 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
Install JIRA 7 32 bit on Windows 7 64 bit

h3. Expected Results
JIRA 7 32 bit should run and work perfectly

h3. Actual Results
The installation is successful, but navigating to JIRA instance URL does not return anything.
Also there won't be any JIRA Home directory. 
User is not able to run the JIRA Service. 

h3. Workaround
in file {{<install-dir>\bin\service.bat}} locate line:
{code}set "EXECUTABLE=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\tomcat8.exe.x64"{code}
and replace it with (remove x64):
{code}set "EXECUTABLE=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\tomcat8.exe"{code}
in file {{bin/check-java.bat}} remove quotes around {{%_EXECJAVA%}}
fields.summary: Unable To Install JIRA 7 32 bit on Windows 64 bit

h3. Summary

When clicking from the comments tab to history or all in the activity section of a JIRA issue you will see a 'Communications Breakdown' error. The development tools in Chrome show a 404.

* JIRA Cloud 7.0.OD-7
* JIRA Server 6.4.X and JIRA 7.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ESS-64 without logging in.
# Click the 'History' tab

_*OR*_

# Create a new project and issue
# Change the permission for the project to allow 'anyone' to browse project/administer project
# Log out
# Go to any of the issue from the new project
# Click on the history/activity tab

h3. Expected Results

Show the history/activity tab contents.

h3. Actual Results
*For JIRA 6.4.x*
The UI throws a 'Communications Breakdown' error with the text

{noformat}
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser
{noformat}

Development tools show a 404 error.
 !activity1.png|thumbnail! 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

{noformat}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. 
If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard
{noformat}
 !activity.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
The "Report a problem" link in the footer doesn't actually allow problems in the software to be reported, nor does there appear to be any alternative way to do so. It appears to just be a shortcut to create a new issue in the local instance of Jira, which of course is not going to allow problems with the software to actually be reported to Atlassian. (It took me a significant amount of searching to even find this site to report the problem with the Report a problem link.)

There are already much more obvious ways to create local issues. That is what Jira is for after all. "Report a problem" should allow users to report problems with Jira itself.
fields.summary: "Report a problem" link doesn't actually do what it is supposed to

fields.summary: Can not save and create Issue in add on Zaphyr evaluation version.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45565].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Only admins can create issues into multiple JIRA projects using the CSV importer. Non-admin can only create multiple issue into a single JIRA project and don't have access to this page:

 !csv.jpg|thumbnail! 


h5. Suggestion
Allow non-admin users to create issues via CSV on multiple projects at once.
fields.summary: Allow non-admin users to create issues into multiple JIRA projects using the CSV importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45564].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently we have the pre-defined categories (see screenshot), they are limited in the sense that I can't see for examples, all bugs in the current release.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow custom filters to add to this panel as a category, which will allow for easier browsing of the release.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to customize the release report tab header to include custom filters
Update the atlassian-whitelist plugin to a version >= 1.18 to fix https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AW-6
When some async operations fail they show a window.alert()

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The incremental Synchronization with Crowd fails under the following conditions:
* Crowd is connected to an External Directory (Connector).
* The user has logged into JIRA at least once and synchronized default group memberships.
* The user is renamed in the external directory.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.11
* Crowd 2.8.3
* Win2k8 R2 Active Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the user {{jsmith}} on AD.
# Connect Crowd 2.8.3 to AD (connector).
# Configure {{Default group memberships}} on Crowd to a group with access to JIRA (e.g. {{jira-users}} or {{jira-core-users}}).
# Connect JIRA to Crowd with incremental synchronization enabled.
# Perform a full synchronization on Crowd and then JIRA - The user {{jsmith}} will be visible on JIRA.
# Login to JIRA as {{jsmith}} - The group memberships will be synchronized and {{jsmith}} will be added to the group configured on Crowd's {{Default group memberships}}.
# Rename the user on AD (e.g. to {{john.smith}}).
# Synchronize the directory on Crowd - The username will change to {{john.smith}}.
# Synchronize the Crowd directory on JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
The username should be updated to {{john.smith}} during the incremental synchronization.

h3. Actual Results
The incremental synchronization fails and the following exception is thrown:
{noformat}
2015-09-28 15:08:28,139 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 ERROR anonymous 681x28x1 1mlipxo 192.168.10.174 /secure/SetupLicense.jspa [com.atlassian.scheduler.JobRunnerResponse] Unable to synchronise directory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user rename functionality doesn't work when JIRA is authenticating on Crowd with incremental synchronization, connected to an external directory.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.11
* Crowd 2.8.3
* Win2k8 R2 Active Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the user {{jsmith}} on AD.
# Connect Crowd 2.8.3 to AD (connector).
# Connect JIRA to Crowd with incremental synchronization enabled.
# Perform a full synchronization on Crowd and then JIRA - The user {{jsmith}} will be visible on JIRA.
# Rename the user on AD (e.g. to {{john.smith}}).
# Synchronize the directory on Crowd - The username will change to {{john.smith}}.
# Synchronize the Crowd directory on JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
The username should be updated to {{john.smith}}.

h3. Actual Results
The username will not be updated.

h3.Workaround
There are two workarounds for this issue:
# Ask the user to try to log into JIRA with the {{john.smith}} username. The login will synchronize the user with Crowd.
# Perform a full synchronization between JIRA and Crowd.
fields.summary: User rename doesn't work using Crowd with incremental synchronization
Update Migrating JIRA do Another Server document

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA allows project import from CSV, Bugzilla, Redmine... but not XML. It would make migration from own installation much easier.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the possibility to import project from XML.
 
h3. Workaround 
If possible, the XML file can be converted to JSON and then follow the instructions at [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Importing+Data+from+JSON]. Also, data can be imported from CSV as per [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Importing+Data+from+CSV].

h3. Problem Definition

JIRA will enforce a dot or a comma on a Number Field (custom field) depending on the language specified. For example:

In English I would use 1.5 while in Russian you would use 1,5. 
This can become an issue when a customer wants to use 1.5 while using a Russian language pack in this example.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA's Windows Installer sticks to first choice of port numbers and doesn't change afterwards.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Run JIRA Windows installer
# Choose *Custom installation*
# Choose a custom port, either for HTTP or Control;ceee
# Proceed until the *Installation Summary* screen;
# Go back to the port settings screen;
# Change the custom port number or select the option for using default ports;
# Notice that, when reaching the *Installation Summary* once again, the ports will be setup with the numbers entered at first run;

h3. Expected behavior
JIRA will change the used port at anytime during the installation process if an user chooses to do so by going back to the ports setup screen.

h3. Actual behavior
JIRA sticks to the first choice of port numbers and won't change to different ones after the *Installation Summary* has been reached.

h3. Workaround
Cancel the installation and restart it.
fields.summary: JIRA's Windows Installer will stick to first choice of port numbers

When creating application links from JIRA to Confluence, it should redirect back to JIRA after the authentication is successful at Confluence.

h3. Actual Results

Stay in the confluence page ([^confluencepage.png]) and do nothing. The application links is created in JIRA but not Confluence.
 
h3. Notes
No errors on both instances.

h3.Workaround
Login both applications first and then create the application links.
fields.summary: Application links is not redirected after user logged in

fields.description:
This may happen as a result of either:
 * default custom field value exceeding the character limit. This is highly unlikely as the limit is only enabled by default in 7.0+ and set to 32767 characters, but it can also be configured to a lower value by an admin (server only, not configurable in Cloud).
 * environment or description exceeding the character limit - this is a side effect of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43631 and will be fixed in that issue. It's only recorded here for future reference.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
If a user creates a custom field lets say colors and adds in values for the custom field {{green, yellow, red}}. When user adds in a context for the field and then configures a pie chart on the dashboard to get results for the field.

*Steps to Reproduce*
- Create a custom field with values {{Red, Yellow, Green}}
- Configure the field and change the context to as follows
-- *Context 1*: 
--- Bug and Sub Task,
--- Supports all projects.
-- *Context 2*:
--- Bug only,
--- Supports only one project.
--- Add in a similar value as the first {{Red, Yellow Green}}
-- Update the context.
- Create an issue matching each of the contexts you created above.
- Search issues that can match the context and save the filter.
-- {{color is not EMPTY}}
-- Save the filter of the result.
- Add a Pie Chart gadget to your dashboard.
-- Add the filter to the Pie Chart.
-- Specify the colors field as the field you are interested in.

*Expected Result*
JIRA would match the similar valued fields together(All red results would be matched and similar for other values), irrespective of context.

*Actual Result*
JIRA separates the values based on context, hence you have 2 results for Red, 2 for Green and 2 for Yellow.

*Note*
This isn't the result seen for other filters such as Issue Statistic and in a test of an earlier release of JIRA(6.3.10) as those results seem to match the Expected result than the actual result.
fields.summary: Broken Behavior in JIRA Pie Chart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45514].
  {panel}

A field content (native or custom) can be modified via Bulk change (Edit Issues), even if the field is not part of the EDIT screen. This is not consistent with the behavior of the simple Edit operation. When a a field is not part of the EDIT screen - it cannot be modified when the Edit button is clicked - it cannot be modified via the inline edit, but anything can be done via bulk. If a field is not part of the EDIT screen then it's because it's not supposed to be updated via any EDIT operation.
Just to provide more detail: In certain Jira implementations, some fields are supposed to be modified only during particular transitions. These fields are not supposed to be edited via the edit operation. In order to accomplish this we add these fields in the VIEW screen (so anybody can see the content at any time), but we don't add the fields in the EDIT screen (so these fields cannot be update via the edit operation / inline edit). The fields are added only to screens that are displayed during the transitions when the fields are supposed to be modified.
Everything works great but the problem is that if you perform a Bulk change (Edit Issues), everything can be modified, even the fields that were NOT supposed to be editable.
It would make sense to take into account the EDIT screen for all Edit operations, including Bulk Edit too.
fields.summary: Bulk change (Edit Issues) should not be possible for fields that are not part of the EDIT screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45512].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Pasting multi line content from any source to a description or comment field adds or removes line breaks randomly. We're using IE 11.0.9600.18015. Other browsers are not affected. In addition only inline editing or commenting is affected by this bug. Pasting content to a description field in an overlay container (e.g. "Create Issue" not in a new browser tab or "Edit Issue") works fine.

h3. Environment
* Cloud and Server using IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using IE 11
# Add "Comment" to an issue
# Copy and Paste a multi line text block

h3. Expected Results
Formatting preserved

h3. Actual Results
Line breaks will be added or removed randomly
 
h3. Notes
Additional Testing on Windows 8.1 Enterprise with:
- IE 11.0.9600.18036 
- IE 11.0.9600.17937

h3.Workaround
Works in Chrome and Firefox
fields.summary: Copy & paste multi line text to description or comment scrambles line breaks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45511].
  {panel}

Hi, 
I have this scenario

Project with ServiceDesk enabled.
Issue has no attachment
User make a transition and in a transition screen adds an attachment
Userr wants to "publish" attachment and transition in one step. Ie comment in the attachment in the comment field.

Result: Attachment ikon is not displayed in rich text editor.

Consequence: Two steps for the user. 1. Upload the attachment 2. transition issue and add attachment in comment field

Suggestion: Make the attachment ikon display as soon as there is an attachment chosen in the screen.
fields.summary: Update the attachment ikon in richtextedit on the fly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45508].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no email notification for first time login for any users in JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful for Administrators to get notified via email when new users/users from external user directories login for the first time to JIRA. For this to be available, JIRA need to have an option to turn on "First Time User Login" notification option.
fields.summary: Notification for first time login in JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When upgrading from an earlier version of JIRA, in this case 4.2, the user finds documentation which tells them they can upgrade directly to the latest version of JIRA: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/skipping-major-versions-when-upgrading-jira-311920132.html

However when reading the upgrade notes from 6.4, the document states that they must first upgrade to 4.4.5: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-6-4-upgrade-notes-687014821.html

h3. Expected Results

These two documents should contain consistent, not conflicting information.
fields.summary: JIRA upgrade information from older versions is inconsistant
Add Default Application option to User Directories

fields.description:
The REST resource rest/api/2/workflow.json returns a list of workflows with names but not the id. So there's no easy way to retrieve more details about each workflow because you don't get the id.

Use case: retrieve the XML of multiple workflows to check that a post function is present in all cases

fields.description:
When I try to move a user story from one project to another, it gives me an error saying "Issue type not supported".

However, I have the same workflow scheme for both projects so the issue type of Story should be supported.

Do you know if this is a bug or am I missing something in my configuration?

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Moving a user story gives type not supported error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45499].
  {panel}

The following example is made from adding a comment to an issue. AFAICS this affects both adding comments and creating issues.

Prerequisite: an image has been attached to the issue.

1) I start writing a comment with some text and add an image from the normal image button

!comment-1.PNG|thumbnail!

2) I press the little blue "Preview" button and the text + image is previewed

!comment-2.PNG|thumbnail!

3) While previewing I then click on the image to zoom in

!comment-3.PNG|thumbnail!

The image is shown as an overlay, but the url has changed away from the issue and it is now impossible for me to get back to the comment, that I was drafting. I cannot press ESC. If I click the back button, I get back to the issue, but my draft is gone.
fields.summary: Comment preview+zoom on image => back to comment not possible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45497].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
An Admin might want to request additional information when creating a user in JIRA or would like to make some of the fields we made compulsory optional as they do not meet his company's requirements.

However as the Create User pop-up is quite restricted and has no means of being customized as it is hard coded, the user cannot change the fields configuration.

*Expected Feature*
Add a page that allows users customize what appears when the create issue is pressed.

*Actual Functionality*
All fields seem to be hard-coded and cannot be modified.
fields.summary: Add Ability to customize fields in Create user pop-up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45494].
  {panel}

Some users are experiencing a problem with JIRA gadgets, when effected no gadgets (except the Introduction gadget) load, and error messages are displayed: 

"This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard."

When attempting to add a new gadget to the dashboard, only the Introduction gadget is listed. 

Errors appear in the logs for example: 
{noformat}
/secure/Dashboard.jspa [c.a.g.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl] Error occurred while retrieving gadget spec for rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/activitystream-gadget.xml
/secure/Dashboard.jspa [c.a.g.embedded.internal.GadgetUrlBuilder] GadgetUrlBuilder: could not parse spec at rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/activitystream-gadget.xml
{noformat}

Workaround
* Restart JIRA
* (JIRA Cloud customers should log a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com to arrange a restart)


P.S: Instances affected by this bug have also reported problems on:
* Viewing agile boards with a filter with more than 1 project
* Service desk email handler can't retrieve emails (the connection log shows an error)
fields.summary: No gadgets load in JIRA, unable to add new gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45493].
  {panel}

Supported functions list versionMatch
fixVersion in (versionMatch("15.2.*"))

However version match is actually a [Script Runner|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/jql-functions.html] function. This is causing confusion as it implies this is a default JQL function of JIRA. 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching

Reproduce:

Try query above. Not a JQL Query function error. Enable Script Runner the function works. 

You can see in the Script Runner documentation that is listed as an extended JQL function.
fields.summary: Please clarify versionMatch is actually a script runner plugin in our documentation for advanced search.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45492].
  {panel}

On the instalation in linux:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA061/Installing+JIRA+on+Linux

It is stated that there is an express install and a custom install, however, the instalation options are not shown nor their default values.

On the other hand, if using Ngnix proxy, the setup will never run with the default configuration.

Additionally, if running under vagrant, it redirects from the stated domainname to localhost (which is incorrect as it is assuming it is running under "localhost" name).
fields.summary: Instalation shortfalls in documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45491].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Currently, each user needs to select custom avatars for its own account. It is not possible to a JIRA admin upload an avatar image that behaves like the system default ones.

h5. Suggestion
Implement an option to allow a JIRA administrator to upload an avatar that will be accessible for all users.
fields.summary: Allow a JIRA administrator to upload custom avatars that can be selected by any user

fields.description:
h5. Problem Statement
When moving an issue from a project A to a project B, the Retain data checkbox appears even if a required field from the source project has an empty value. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Try to move an issue from project A from project B
# If a required field on project B is empty on the issue, while moving, the update fields screen will show up
# The Retain data checkbox appears, even though there is no data to retain and checking it does not cause any side effect

h5. Expected Behavior
Retain data checkbox would not appear, since it is required to have the field to have data filled in and it is pointless to have this checkbox there.
fields.summary: Retain data checkbox appears when a required field is empty when moving an issue from a project to another
